Summary Graduated as an electronic engineer from the National School of Engineering of Sousse (ENISO), 
My experience started by a final project in STMicroelectronics which consists on developing an application using C++/Qt framework, on an embedded environment (STLinux + SetTopBox) 
after that I was integrated in the validation team, and I started working on wifi integration / validation / bug fixing on ST SetTopBox, also, I worked on validating/ pre-certification / bug fixing of the USB2.0 controller, and of the Video Transport IP of ST SetTopBox. 
Now I'm working on integrating and bug fixing of all wifi related issue on Android Intel mobile platforms.

Experience Embedded Software Engineer in Intel Corporation on behalf of Celad Intel Corporation January 2014  – Present (1 year 8 months) Sophia Antipolis, Nice Area, France From January 2014 till now : I’m part of Connectivity and Wireless team : 
• Integration of wifi drivers and tools on an embedded environment based on Android Intel mobile platforms. 
• Debugging and Bug fixing of all wifi related issues from Android stack to driver stack : Wifi ; P2P, Wi-Di, Android level, Linux, wpa_supplicant, wifi driver... 
 Embedded Software Engineer STMicroelectronics September 2013  –  December 2013  (4 months) Tunisia From September 2013 till December 2013: I'm part of the video transport team: 
• Functional Validation of the different sub-blocks of the video Transport IP of ST set top box. 
• Development of a kernel module for validating the Video Transport IP. Embedded Software Engineer STMicroelectronics May 2013  –  August 2013  (4 months) Tunisia -	From May 2013 till August 2013: Support the validation / pre-certification of USB2.0 IP: 
• USB2.0 functional and electrical Validation : following the USB2.0 specification in order to verify the compliance of our chips with the USB2.0 standard. 
• Development of kernel module for configuring the USB controller in such test modes & debugging using Debugfs. Wireless integration & Validation engineer STMicroelectronics Tunis August 2011  –  April 2013  (1 year 9 months) Tunis, Tunisie -	Responsible of integrating/ validating wifi devices (IEEE802.11a/b/g/n/ac) on ST SetTopBox : 
• Integration of wireless device driver under STLinux tree. 
• Validation and performance measurements : definition of a validation scenarios that include several tests with different settings (AP/STA performance measurements : throughput for TCP/UDP transfers, 802.11a/b/g/n/ac, CPU load, number on interruptions, interoperability and stress tests...) 
• Debugging and Profiling of STLinux and wifi driver to define the consumption of each layer (USB, TCP / IP, wifi ...) 
• Analyzing wifi packets using some sniffer softwares like Iptraf, tcpdump... 
• Configuration and performance measurements of complex environments : wifi-NAS Server, http server, wifi to Ethernet bridge on ST boards, wifi video Streaming... 
• Tested devices : Realtek, Quatenna, Lantiq, Qualcomm, Ralink, 1Tx1R, 2Tx2R, 3Tx3R, 4Tx4R. 
• Customer support / Bug fixing. 
• "How to" and documentation redaction. Graduation Project STMicroelectronics February 2011  –  June 2011  (5 months) Tunis •	Development of an application "Record and Play" from a USB 2.0 webcam on a platform STi7108/STLinux : Engineering Final Project during five months, done at "STMicroelectronics Tunis" in the validation Team. 
•	The application purpose is to capture a video stream from a webcam USB 2.0, recording or playing of video stream to or from a hard disk USB2.0. 
•	The application was developed in an embedded environment based on the system chip STi7108 digital decoder "SetTopBox" high definition which run an embedded operating system kernel -2.6.32 STLinux. 
•	Used tools : C + + graphics library QT4.6, and the tools FFmpeg and V4L2.  
•	By running the application, I performed validation tests on the different USB transfer types available on the platform using the CATC Protocol Analyzer. 
•	I added also the possibility to transfer data (video and text) via Ethernet. Summary A highly experienced software engineer with expertise in C, C++ and scripting languages with a heavy emphasis on security and debugging. Not afraid to drop into assembler if appropriate. Enjoys mentoring and passing on knowledge. Currently a contributer to the golang project, and previously made significant contributions to other opensource projects such as emacs and perl. Moderated a Usenet newsgroup. Summary A highly experienced software engineer with expertise in C, C++ and scripting languages with a heavy emphasis on security and debugging. Currently a contributer to the golang project, and previously made significant contributions to other opensource projects such as emacs and perl. Moderated a Usenet newsgroup. Experience Software Engineer Intel Corporation August 2012  – Present (3 years 1 month) Worked for the Software Methodologies and Tools team. 
Trained 80% of the US based engineers working on net generation modem chips and provided 3rd line support. Principal Software Engineer Bytemobile August 2010  –  August 2012  (2 years 1 month) Santa Clara Senior Software Engineer Brocade 2005  –  August 2010  (5 years) San Jose Root caused lots of previously “impossible” core files. 
Gave almost weekly knowledge transfer sessions 
Wrote program that monitored ASICs and “hot patched” values to correct incorrect values, to avoid the need for costly rework of chips. Senior Software Engineer Syndeo Corporation 2002  –  2004  (2 years) San Jose Designed and implemented a new build process. Net Result: Build time for full build cut from 8 hours to 2 hours, and build time overhead for incremental builds cut from 15 minutes to 12 seconds.  
 
Designed and implemented an "autobuild" system. Previously almost all numbered builds failed, wasting large amounts of time as people scrambled to provided fixes. Now 95% of numbered builds complete, and those that fail are known in advance. Net Result: Savings of over 2500 man-hours a year and a much more stable product. 
 
Designed and implemented a new logging system. The original system slowed the system by a factor of 20, making logging unusable. The new one has negligible effect. Net Result: Logging is turned on in the field, enabling real time diagnosis of one-off issues without the need to reproduce them. Senior Software Engineer Marconi 2000  –  2002  (2 years) Dallas/Fort Worth Area On Secondment from Marconi in the UK 
 
Led development of a GR303 residential gateway for the US market. Net Result: Made the first delivery to launch customer on target securing a $10 million order. 
 
Set up Lab, with 4 complete (but minimal) VoIP exchanges. Senior Software Engineer Marconi 1998  –  2000  (2 years) United Kingdom Developed a Board Support Package for custom hardware. 
 
Specified a gateway card design. Net Result: A card that was delivered on time that was flexible enough to be used as the basis for the Marconi VoIP solution. 
 
Primary technical contact from the software to the hardware development teams. 
 
Developed test software for our hardware. I wrote the initial test software that enabled the hardware team to find problems in their FPGA design, and led the team that wrote the factory test software. 
 
Designed and implemented a specialized high performance IP stack. My stack ran at over 22,000 packets per second under PSOS (and over 35,000 under Linux). Net Result: A system that was marketable. It was installed as the sole backup for Jersey Telecom in 2000. 
 
Instigated in-house knowledge transfer sessions, and gave more than the whole of the rest of the company, on subjects ranging from the overall design strategy, through general TCP/IP, to detailed explanations of the boot sequence. Director of Information Technology Asian University of Science and Technology 1997  –  1998  (1 year) Thailand Senior Computer Officer University of Bath 1982  –  1997  (15 years) Bath, United Kingdom Built the first firewall on the UK Academic Network. 
 
Co-Authored the national paper on why the UK Academic network should switch to IP from X.25, together with a list of precautions on the risks. 
 
Implemented a single sign-on system for the university computers, based on Kerberos. 
 
Authored and presented paper at the first UK Academic Security conference. 
 
Designed and implemented a firewall for the University of the West of England. 
 
Lectured TCP/IP and SNMP for post graduate courses. Software Engineer Intel Corporation August 2012  – Present (3 years 1 month) Worked for the Software Methodologies and Tools team.

Reaserch student University of Colombo School of Computing August 2010  –  August 2011  (1 year 1 month) Srilanka For university final year research, I improved an effectiveness of file sharing mechanism in Eucalyptus based Cloud environment on top of Xen hypervisor. There are lots of approaches which have been taken to the improve effectiveness of file sharing in Eucalyptus based Cloud environment. We have been used two main approaches to address this problem, which did not harm the scalability of the Cloud environment. Our first approach, implement the locking mechanism for the cloud controller which act as the main control unit of the Cloud environment by adding the some classes to the Eucalyptus source package. Then as a next step we integrate version enabling mechanism for the Walrus by adding the copy on write feature with Btrfs file system. Finally we are able to keep the consistency with scalability by using above two approaches.
